summary: This document is an email from whistleblower Christopher J. Dilorio to Judge Oetken and others, forwarding a formal appeal regarding SEC denial of a covered action (2015-016) related to Knight Capital. It contains extensive allegations of SEC corruption, ongoing securities fraud, money laundering through shell companies, and connections between various individuals and entities in the financial industry. The email references multiple SEC filings, companies, and individuals involved in alleged fraudulent schemes. This document is a series of emails from whistleblower Christopher J Dilorio to various officials, alleging widespread SEC corruption, market manipulation, and money laundering. It details connections between financial entities like Virtu Financial (NITE), Riot Blockchain, Aegis Capital, and individuals including Barry Honig, Doug Cifu, and others, accusing the SEC of facilitating and covering up fraud.

persons.name: Christopher J. Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the email, making extensive allegations of SEC corruption and securities fraud, identifying himself as the whistleblower who uncovered the schemes.

persons.name: Judge Oetken
persons.context: Addressed in the email, described as potentially receiving fraudulent SEC complaints.

persons.name: Paul Arena
persons.role: CEO of Parallax Health Sciences, Inc.
persons.context: Named as a defendant in an SEC complaint regarding misleading COVID-19 disclosures, and alleged to be involved in multiple money laundering shell companies.

persons.name: Nathaniel Bradley
persons.role: Executive at Parallax Health Sciences, Inc.
persons.context: Named as a defendant alongside Paul Arena in the SEC complaint regarding misleading COVID-19 disclosures.

persons.name: Keith Coulston
persons.context: Identified as the person behind Ionic Ventures, described as a 'prolific Bag Men' involved in money laundering shells.

persons.name: Michael Sobeck
persons.role: Associated with Harbor Gates Capital LLC
persons.context: Described as a 'Prolific Bag Men' formerly with Tangiers, involved in NITE top traded shells like NYXIO.

persons.name: Christina Avila
persons.role: Associated with Harbor Gates Capital LLC
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Michael Sobeck as part of Harbor Gates Capital LLC in Puerto Rico.

persons.name: Richard Rosenblum
persons.role: Controls Cobran LLC and involved with Innovative Payment Solutions (IPSI)
persons.context: Identified as controlling Cobran LLC and involved in OTC bb shell Innovative Payment Solutions (IPSI), with connections to QIWI and NetElement.

persons.name: David Stefansky
persons.role: Associated with Harborview Advisors and Aquamed Technologies/Nexgel
persons.context: Mentioned as being involved with Harborview Advisors and money laundering shell Aquamed Technologies (now Nexgel), controlled alongside Nachum Stein.

persons.name: Nachum Stein
persons.role: CEO/Chairman of American European Insurance Group
persons.context: Identified as controlling Aquamed/Nexgel with David Stefansky and serving as CEO/Chairman of American European Insurance Group.

persons.name: Robert Klimov
persons.context: Described as an 'Investor' in IPSI through Bellridge Capital, also involved in money laundering shell Black Cactus Global Inc.

persons.name: Milton Ault
persons.role: Controller of DPW Holdings (now Ault Group)
persons.context: Identified as controlling DPW Holdings (now Ault Group), parent company of Digital Power Lending LLC.

persons.name: Michael Wachs
persons.role: Associated with Esousa and Net Element
persons.context: Mentioned as part of Esousa, an investor in DPW, and connected to Net Element and his ex-wife.

persons.name: Peizer
persons.role: Partner of Michael Wachs, associated with FreeSeas/TopShips
persons.context: Identified as a partner of Michael Wachs, involved with FreeSeas/TopShips, and connected to Milken obstruction of justice with David Solomon.

persons.name: David Solomon
persons.context: Referenced as 'djdsol' and current CEO of Goldman Sachs, mentioned in connection with Milken obstruction of justice.

persons.name: Kevin Goodman
persons.role: SEC OCIE BD's Chief Overlord of FINRA
persons.context: Described as being made Chief Overlord of FINRA, overseeing the SEC OCIE FINRA and Securities Industry Oversight (FSIO) group, and implicated in SEC obstruction and corruption.

persons.name: Pete Driscoll
persons.role: Director of the SEC's Office of Compliance Inspections and Examinations
persons.context: Mentioned as an official from the SEC who met with FINRA's Board of Governors.

persons.name: Ofer Abarbanel
persons.context: Named in an SEC complaint referenced in the email, alleged to have transferred approximately $102,000,000 of investor funds into NARL accounts.

persons.name: Nicholas Abbate
persons.role: COO of State Funds/New York Alaska, former independent Market Maker at Knight Capital
persons.context: Identified as the COO of State Funds/New York Alaska, which received $102,000,000 in investor funds, and as a former independent Market Maker at Knight Capital.

persons.name: Dick Best
persons.context: Referenced in connection with Brown Brothers Harriman, described as a penny stock money launderer.

persons.name: Clayton
persons.context: Referenced in the context of 'main street investors' and a grossly corrupt rule that exempts 90% of current 13F filers.

persons.name: Peirce
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Clayton and Roisman regarding a corrupt rule.

persons.name: Roisman
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Clayton and Peirce regarding a corrupt rule.

persons.name: Paley
persons.role: Head of SEC Micro Cap Fraud Task Force (referenced)
persons.context: Addressed rhetorically questioning the accomplishments of the Micro Cap Fraud Task Force.

persons.name: Gensler
persons.context: Urged to execute the will of Congress regarding repealing a corrupt rule.

persons.name: Chair Waters
persons.context: Mentioned as making repealing a corrupt SEC rule a priority.

persons.name: Honig
persons.context: Referenced as a prolific bag man connected to Russian entities, Signature Bank (SBNY), and the law firm Sichenzia Ross.

persons.name: Gottschall
persons.context: Addressed rhetorically about locating Castle Rock on a map, in context of RIOT Blockchain filings.

persons.name: Mathis Schultz
persons.context: Identified as the founder of Northern Data AG (formerly Northern Bitcoin), a former private banker at Julius Baer, LGT, and Elan Capital Management.

persons.name: Chad Everett Harris
persons.context: Described as the person chosen by Mathis Schultz to build the 1Gig+ 'HPC' data center in Rockdale, Texas for Northern Data.

persons.name: Christopher J Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the emails, making extensive allegations of SEC corruption, market manipulation, and money laundering related to Knight Capital, Virtu Financial, Riot Blockchain, and other entities.

persons.name: Doug Cifu
persons.context: Accused of knowingly lying about equity market making share volumes on a May 2021 earnings call to conceal illegal naked shorting and money laundering.

persons.name: Alex Kramm
persons.context: Had an exchange with Doug Cifu on the Q1 2021 earnings call; referenced by Dilorio to challenge Cifu's transparency.

persons.name: Dan Fannon
persons.context: Addressed by Doug Cifu on the Q1 2021 earnings call regarding share volumes.

persons.name: Ms. Pasquinelli
persons.context: Addressed in an email regarding SEC actions based on Dilorio's information not being posted to the OWB Award Eligible website.

persons.name: Joshua Sason
persons.context: Named in an SEC action (NewLead) based on Dilorio's information; associated with Magna, Hanover, and multiple frauds.

persons.name: John M. Fife
persons.context: Charged by the SEC for acquiring/selling over 21 billion penny stock shares; controls Chicago Venture Partners, Iliad Research.

persons.name: Justin Keener
persons.role: Alleged Unregistered Penny Stock Dealer (JMJ Financial)
persons.context: Charged by the SEC for unregistered penny stock dealing.

persons.name: Mr. Gottschall
persons.context: Accused of conducting a grossly inadequate investigation into Riot Blockchain, failing to visit its headquarters, and facilitating fraud.

persons.name: Barry Honig
persons.context: Central figure accused of controlling multiple money laundering shells including MGT Capital, Inergetics, and being involved with Riot Blockchain (fka Bioptix).

persons.name: Stetson
persons.context: Sidekick to Barry Honig; involved in money laundering shells like Therapix/SciSparc and Bioptix/RIOT.

persons.name: David Urban
persons.role: Trump PA Campaign Manager, NITE Board Member
persons.context: Linked to his own alleged money laundering shell, FSD Pharma.

persons.name: Robert Eide
persons.context: Named in FINRA/SEC actions; his pension plan was a seller in SciSparc offering. Aegis is accused of being a prolific money launderer.

persons.name: Kevin McKenna
persons.context: Named in SEC action for aiding and abetting Aegis violations.

persons.name: Charles Smulevitz
persons.context: Named in FINRA order accepting settlement.

persons.name: Brian Colleran
persons.context: Paid $19.5M to resolve False Claims Act allegations; became a large shareholder in Millennium Biotech/Inergetics, which was controlled by Barry Honig.

persons.name: Chad Readler
persons.context: Was the prosecutor on the Brian Colleran civil case; later made a federal judge by Trump.

persons.name: Mark B Fisher
persons.role: Owner of MBF Clearing and MBF Capital
persons.context: His entities were involved in a fraud 'acquisition' by Riot Blockchain; based in New York but linked to Miami, possibly connected to SEC Director Eric Bustilloe.

persons.name: Eric Bustilloe
persons.context: Described as a 'grossly corrupt Piece of Shit' possibly connected to Mark Fisher.

persons.name: Dmitry Akhanov
persons.role: CEO of Rusnano USA, Head of Russian Federal Energy Agency
persons.context: Appeared as a Bioptix/Alphasniffer insider in 2015; linked to Russian entity Rusnano, raising national security concerns regarding Riot Blockchain.

persons.name: Judge Cote
persons.context: Sentenced Dan Kamensky; accused by Dilorio of presiding over a gross miscarriage of justice due to a corrupt relationship between the SEC and Handler/Jefferies.

persons.name: Dan Kamensky
persons.context: Sentenced by Judge Cote; Dilorio claims he was set up by Handler/Ressler for interfering with a deal involving Neiman Marcus.

persons.name: Handler
persons.context: Alleged to have a corrupt relationship with the SEC; involved in the situation with Dan Kamensky and Ares Management.

persons.name: Ressler
persons.context: Co-founder of Ares Management (Drexel background with Handler); allegedly set up Dan Kamensky to protect a deal involving Neiman Marcus.

persons.name: Jason Sunstein
persons.context: San Diego resident who is CFO of several alleged money laundering shells like Viper Networks and Santeon Group.

persons.name: Ashraf Rofail
persons.context: CEO of Santeon Group, linked to International Land Alliance.

connections.description: Dilorio is sending an email appeal to Judge Oetken, making allegations of SEC fraud on the courts.
Both are named as defendants in an SEC complaint regarding misleading COVID-19 disclosures for Parallax Health Sciences, Inc.
Coulston is associated with Ionic Ventures, which is described as formerly Ironridge, a firm known to the SEC.
Both are associated with Harbor Gates Capital LLC, identified as selling shareholders in Parallax.
Klimov/Bellridge Capital is identified as an investor in IPSI, a company Rosenblum is involved with.
Both are described as controlling Aquamed Technologies/Nexgel together.
Wachs's Esousa is identified as an investor in DPW Holdings, which is controlled by Ault.
Peizer is identified as a partner of Michael Wachs.
Goodman is described as the Chief Overlord of FINRA, overseeing the SEC OCIE FINRA and Securities Industry Oversight group.
Abarbanel transferred approximately $102,000,000 of investor funds into NARL accounts, where Abbate was COO of the State Fund receiving the funds.
Schultz chose Harris to build the 1Gig+ 'HPC' data center in Rockdale, Texas for Northern Data AG.
Described as associates involved together in multiple alleged money laundering shells like Therapix/SciSparc and Bioptix/RIOT.
Both are alleged 'bag men' involved in overlapping money laundering schemes; Sason's entities held shares in Inergetics, which Honig controlled.
Alleged that the SEC, including officials like Gottschall, knowingly allows Cifu/Virtu to conceal illegal activity and commit fraud on the public.
Both named in regulatory actions against Aegis Capital for violations.
Colleran became a large shareholder in Millennium Biotech/Inergetics, which was controlled by Barry Honig.
Fisher's entities have a Miami connection, and Bustilloe is the SEC Director in Miami, implying a possible corrupt relationship.
Akhanov was an insider in Bioptix (which became RIOT) through a 2015 offering, linking the Russian entity Rusnano to the US-listed company.
Both have a Drexel background and were involved in the Neiman Marcus deal where Dan Kamensky was allegedly set up.
Dilorio is the whistleblower alleging the SEC is corruptly obstructing his claims and facilitating the frauds he uncovered.

events.title: Email Appeal to Judge Oetken
events.description: Christopher J. Dilorio sends an email forwarding a formal appeal regarding SEC denial of covered action 2015-016, making extensive allegations of SEC corruption.

events.title: Prior Email on SEC Complaint
events.description: Dilorio sent a prior email regarding an SEC complaint against Ofer Abarbanel, alleging omissions and connections to Nicholas Abbate, Brown Brothers Harriman, and Mosaic/Old Fort.

events.title: Prior Email Alleging SEC Corruption
events.description: Dilorio sent a prior email alleging the SEC is a grossly corrupt, criminal enterprise facilitating fraud on the public.

events.title: FINRA Board of Governors Meeting
events.description: FINRA's Board of Governors met and engaged with SEC officials including Pete Driscoll, approving rule proposals and receiving operational updates.

events.title: Sale of Whinstone US to Riot Blockchain
events.description: Northern Data AG completed the sale of its Texas data center subsidiary, Whinstone US, Inc., to Riot Blockchain, Inc.

events.title: Virtu Financial Q1 2021 Earnings Call
events.description: CEO Doug Cifu stated April volumes were 'a hair under 10 billion shares per day,' which Dilorio alleges is a knowing lie to conceal much higher volumes from illegal naked shorting.

events.title: SEC Ends Investigation into Riot Blockchain
events.description: SEC official Mr. Gottschall sent a letter terminating the investigation into Riot Blockchain without recommending enforcement action. Dilorio claims the investigation was grossly inadequate.

events.title: SEC Charges Joshua Sason et al.
events.description: SEC filed charges against Joshua Sason and others in an elaborate microcap stock fraud. Dilorio claims this action was based on his information.

events.title: SEC Charges John M. Fife
events.description: SEC charged John M. Fife and companies he controls for acquiring and selling over 21 billion shares of penny stock without registering as a dealer.

events.title: SEC Charges Justin Keener
events.description: SEC charged Justin W. Keener d/b/a JMJ Financial as an unregistered penny stock dealer.

events.title: Ongoing SEC-Facilitated Frauds
events.description: Dilorio alleges that as of May 2021, the illegal activities he detailed (naked shorting, money laundering via OTCM shells) are ongoing due to SEC corruption.

Miami, Florida (linked to Mark B Fisher and SEC Director Eric Bustilloe)
San Diego, California (linked to Jason Sunstein, Ashraf Rofail, and SEC LA office)
keyFacts: The whistleblower, Christopher J. Dilorio, alleges the SEC is a 'grossly corrupt, criminal organization' actively facilitating massive, ongoing frauds on the public.

The email references an SEC complaint against Parallax Health Sciences, Inc., Paul Arena, and Nathaniel Bradley for misleading COVID-19 disclosures, which Dilorio claims is itself a fraud on the court.
Multiple individuals and entities (e.g., Keith Coulston/Ionic, Michael Sobeck, Richard Rosenblum) are identified as 'prolific Bag Men' involved in money laundering through OTC shell companies.
Connections are drawn between financial figures, shell companies, and international entities, including alleged links to Russian spies and Chinese nationals in some schemes.
The email alleges SEC and FINRA corruption, specifically naming Kevin Goodman and referencing outsourcing of OTC market oversight to FINRA, which is portrayed as a captured regulator.

The whistleblower, Christopher J Dilorio, alleges the SEC is grossly corrupt and actively facilitates and covers up massive, ongoing frauds involving illegal naked shorting and money laundering through OTC market shells.

Riot Blockchain (fka Aspen Bio, Venaxis, Bioptix) is alleged to be a Honig/Stetson money laundering shell with ties to Russian entity Rusnano via insider Dmitry Akhanov, posing a national security risk.

Virtu Financial (VIRT/NITE) CEO Doug Cifu is accused of knowingly lying about share volumes to conceal that the company's core business is illegal naked shorting of OTCM shells to facilitate money laundering.

Multiple SEC enforcement actions (against Joshua Sason, John Fife, Justin Keener) are claimed by Dilorio to be based on his whistleblower information, yet were not posted to the OWB Award Eligible website, suggesting obstruction.

The document alleges deep interconnectedness between alleged money launderers (Honig, Sason), corrupt SEC officials (Gottschall, Bustilloe), and financial entities (Aegis Capital, Signature Bank, Sichenzia Ross law firm).
